Also, why do I need to login to an HP account to use a 15+ year old device sitting on my own desk? Why can't I scan at 600dpi or greater? Before installing, check to see if your device is supported by the "Mopria" app so you can hopefully steer clear of this.

Everything can be done from this HP Printer Smart app. Highly recommending it to anyone willing to get a scanning document app or if you are buying a HP printer on 2026, you will definitely need this app to setup your HP printer =)

author: Richard Husbands
content: The worst, most frustrating app and dishonest marketing I've ever experienced HP 2800e printer plastered all over it is a three month free ink trial. The small print states what is currently advertised on the box, in the box and on Amazon is meaningless." If we want to lie and move the goal posts we can, and you can just suck it" is a 100% reasonable, accurate translation of their legalise. The app is horrible on Android. The most adverts I've ever been been ever been bombarded Shameful.

author: yvette golden
content: It prompted for payment to use some features

author: George Key
content: will not let me log into my account, it just spins

author: Yeray
content: took 20min to be able to print something from the moment I installed the app. So many steps to print a single page. It also REQUIRES you to create an account giving away your data (name, surname, and email) to HP to be able to print something. I'm going to return my printer. Why do I have to create an account to use my own printer? What's next. Will I have to create an account to get into my house, or give my data away to use my car? Why do we let companies get away with this?

author: Stephanie Battle
content: very difficult to add printer

author: josiane morgenstern
content: Multiple interface failures. a Failed to communicate multiple times during setup. Does not allow scrolling on some pages required for setup. Complete garbage.

author: matthew mendat
content: can't get hooked up with this printer

author: terry dixon
content: rubbish

author: Praveen Nair
content: Try printing a 10cms x15cms picture with ease on a A4 paper in Hp Smart Tank printer, if not ease, frustration is guaranteed. HP please grow up. This is year 2026, it won't take ages for a company to go extinct
